05120201-d-12-02-05-MMA.Reporting Railroad Name: Montreal, Maine and Atlantic Railway, Ltd.
05120201-d-12-02-05-MMA.Maintenance Railroad Name: Montreal, Maine and Atlantic Railway, Ltd.
05120201-d-12-02-05-MMA.Narrative: NO 202 WAS PROCEEDING NORTH ON THE MILLINOCKET SUBDIVISION WITH TWO LOCOMOTIVES, 9 LOADS AND 11 EMPTIES.  AT MILE 46.88, APPROXIMATELY 18 MILES INTO THEIR TRIP, THE 16TH CAR IN THE TRAIN, GATX 19088 DIESEL FUEL, EXPERIENCED A BURNED OFF JOURNAL ON THE 2ND WHEEL SET ON THE NORTH END OF THE CAR (A END).  AT MILE 48.70 THE BURNT OFF JOURNAL WHEEL SET KINKED OUT FROM UNDER THE CAR ALLOWING THE SIDE FRAMES TO DROP.  WHEN THE SIDE FRAMES SHIFTED, THE REMAINING AXLE.  THE TRAIN STOPPED AT MILE 52.25 AND NOSED IN THE PASSING SIDING AT SOUTH LAGRANGE TO LIFT SEVERAL LOADS FOR THE CHIPPER.  AFTER LIFTING THE LOADS ON THEIR NOSE THEY BACKED OUT OF THE SIDING AND CONTINUED NORTH ANOTHER 1.2 MILES WHERETHEY STOPPED AGAIN. THEY SHOVED THE LOADS, WHICH WERE ON THEIR NOSE, INTO THE SOUTH END OF THE CHIPLOADING TRACK AT MILE 53.47, SOUTH LAGRANGE.  THEY BACKED OUT OF THE CHIP SIDING AFTER DROPPING THECHIP LOADS AND CONTINUED THEIR TRIP NORTH.  WHEN GATX 19088 ENCOUNTERED THE FACING POINT SWITCH AT MILE 53.47 THE REMAINING AXLE ON THE A END BURNT (BROKE) THROUGH AND DERAILED GATX 19088.  GATX 19088ROLLED TO THE EAST SIDE OF THE TRACK STRIKING (CORNERING) ONE OF THE LOADED CHIP CARS THEY HAD PREVIOUSLY SET ON THE CHIP SIDING.  GATX 16734, DIESEL FUEL, AND MMA 123 EMPTY BOTH FOLLOWED ROLLING ONTHEIR SIDES TO THE EAST SIDE OF THE TRACK.  GMRC 7059 EMPTY DERAILED ONE SET OF WHEELS ON THE B ENDOF THE CAR (DERAILED SIDE).  THE IMPACT SLIGHTLY DAMAGED A VENT LOCATED ON THE TOP OF GATX 19088.

194627-d-12-20-05-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 387-211 WAS PULLING 67 CARLOADS OF SOYBEANS WEST OFF THE HOUSE TRACK AT KENSAL (TRACK OWNED BYKENSAL FARMER'S ELEVATOR).  THEY WERE ALMOST CLEAR OF THE WEST HOUSE TRACK SWITCH THAT LEADS INTO THE SIDING WHEN THE REAR EIGHT (8) CARS OF HIS LIFT DERAILED.  THE VERY WEST CAR OF THE 8 DERAILED CARS ENDED UPRIGHT ON TOP OF THE WEST HOUSE TRACK SWITCH AND STILL HAD THE WEST SET OF TRUCKS ON THE RAIL AND WAS SEPARATED FROM THE OTHER 7 DERAILED CARS.  THE NEXT SIX (6) CARS WERE COMPLETELY OFF THERAIL AND UPRIGHT.  THE VERY EAST, AND 8TH CAR DERAILED, WAS ALSO UPRIGHT WITH ONLY THE EAST SET OFTRUCKS REMAINING ON THE RAIL.  WE HAD THE CREW PUSH THE RAILCAR ON TOP OF THE WEST HOUSE TRACK SWITCH EAST TO CLEAR THE SWITCH SO THAT THE KENSAL SIDING COULD BE PUT BACK IN SERVICE.  THE TRACK WAS TAKEN OOS, AND CLOSE CLEARENCE BULLETIN ISSUED FOR WEST END OF THE HOUSE TRACK. ESTIMATED INDUSTRY TRACK REPAIRS PER ELEVATOR MANAGER, APPROXIMATELY $75,000.00.
